The expert analyzed Rep: Louie Gohmert's claim during an interview on "Fox & Friends" where Gohmert stated that 40 years ago, hardly anyone in the country had health insurance.
The expert found that by 1975: Medicare was covering almost 25 million Americans, and Medicaid was covering about 20 million Americans, indicating that a significant portion of the population had health insurance through these programs.
The expert also examined data on private: either through their employers or purchased individually, suggesting that a large majority of the population had access to private health insurance during that time.
